name: Ducati Monster
description: Ducati Monster je razred naked motornih koles, ki jih je Ducati predstavil leta 1993. Od takrat je postal eden največjih uspehov Ducatija in pomemben del njihove prodajne linije. Monster je bil zasnovan kot gol motocikel z vidnim motorjem in minimalnim ohišjem, z močnim izraznim značajem.

name: Ducati Panigale V4
description: Ducati Panigale V4 je super športni motocikel, ki ga je italijanski proizvajalec motociklov Ducati predstavil leta 2018 kot naslednika modela 1299 Panigale. Je prvi serijski motocikel Ducati z V4 motorjem, ki izhaja neposredno iz Desmosedici MotoGP motocikla.

name: Ducati Panigale
description: The Panigale family, which was named after the town of Borgo Panigale, was born in 2011 and includes sports motorcycles manufactured by Ducati. Replacing the Ducati conventional frame, the motorcycles from the Panigale family use a monocoque frame. In 2015 Ducati introduced the Panigale R.

name: Ducati Diavel
description: The Diavel motorcycle was presented in 2010 at the EICMA Motorcycle Show in Milan and produced from 2011 in two versions: the Dark, which is the standard model, and the Carbon, which featured Marchesini wheels, a carbon front mudguard, carbon tank, and seat cowling, and a coated front suspension.

name: Ducati Monster
description: The first Monster motorcycle was built in 1993 somewhere in Bologna, Italy, and was designed by Miguel Angel Galluzzi. The Monster family had a huge success, accounting in 2005 for more than 50 percent of Ducati sales. In addition to that, the Monster was the favorite platform for other custom motorcycle builders. In 2016, the number of Monsters produced was somewhere around 300,000 units.

name: Ducati Multistrada
description: The Multistrada story started way back in 2003 when the Italian motorcycle manufacturer introduced the Ducati Multistrada, a series of V-twin and V4-powered touring-focused machines designed by Pierre Terblanche.

name: Ducati Hypermotard
description: The Ducati Hypermotard was a supermotard motorcycle built by the Italian Motorcycle manufacturer Ducati, presented at the 2005 EICMA Motorcycle Show in Milan, Italy. The bike was designed by Pierre Terblanche and was awarded "Best of Show" minutes after its unveiling.

name: Ducati Streetfighter
description: The Streetfighter was announced in 2008 at the EICMA fair in Milan and was built by Ducati in 2009. It was a converted superbike without fairings, a longer wheelbase, and a wider handlebar. The characteristics of this motorcycle are a powerful engine and an aggressive look. The Streetfighter was built from 2009 to 2011, and the S version from 2009 to 2012.

name: Ducati Scrambler
description: The Scrambler was initially built by Ducati from 1962 until 1974, especially for the American market. The revived Scrambler was introduced at the 2014 Intermot Motorcycle Show with sales for the U.S. starting in 2015, in seven different configurations: 803cc Classic, Urban Enduro, Icon, Flat Track Pro, Full Throttle, Italia Independent, and the 399cc Sixty2. As of 2017, Ducati made available six different variations of the Ducati Scrambler: Sixty2, Icon, Classic, Full Throttle, Café Racer, and Desert Sled.

name: Ducati DesertX
description: In 2023, the Italian motorcycle manufacturer announced the new Ducati DesertX Rally, an off-road machine dedicated to those riders who crave challenging journeys and rallies.

name: Ducati Supersport
description: In 1988 Ducati started manufacturing the SuperSport, a series of air-cooled four-stroke Desmodromic motorcycles. The 750 Sport and 750 GT were used as a base for the first official SuperSport motorcycles, but featured bodywork style scooped from the Imola bikes. In 1992, a limited edition of the SuperSport was sold under the SuperLight name.

name: Ducati 100
description: Engineer Fabio Taglioni was brought to Ducati in 1954 to design a small, high-performance engine. The result is presented on March 5, 1955, is a beautiful 98 cm3 (49 x 52 mm) which will be quickly updated to 125cc and then to 175cc. This engine is extremely well-designed and will launch Ducati's sporting careers. Marianna is equipped with a four-cylinder air-cooled engine.

name: Ducati 1000
description: The 1984 Ducati 1000S2 comes with features such as a 38mm Marzocchi telescopic front fork, dual Marzocchi shocks as a rear suspension, dual front disc brakes, gold-colored cast-aluminium wheels, a dual exhaust system, a dual seat, a half-fairing with a large windscreen, a race-inspired livery, a large, round headlight and an analogue instrument cluster.

name: Ducati 1098
description: The Ducati 1098 was a sports machine manufactured by Ducati from 2007 to 2009. The bike was made in three versions: Ducati 1098, 1098S, and 1098R. In 2009, the Ducati 1098 was succeeded by the 1198, while the R version remained in production that year.

name: Ducati 1198
description: The Ducati 1198 was a sports bike made by the Italian motorcycle manufacturer Ducati from 2009 to 2012.

name: Ducati 1200
description: The Ducati Berliner 1260 Apollo was a prototype manufactured in 1964 in only two units. It was powered by a 1,257cc V4 engine that delivered 100 hp and could reach a top speed of 190 kph (120 mph).

name: Ducati 125
description: The 1955 Ducati 125 Sport had, at its heart, an air-cooled, four-stroke, 125cc, single cylinder powerplant paired to a four-speed manual transmission that could reach a maximum power output of 10 horsepower at 8500 rpm.

name: Ducati 160
description: The 1965 Ducati 160 Monza Junior sports an air-cooled, four-stroke, 156cc, single cylinder powerplant paired to a four-speed manual transmission and can reach a maximum power output of 10 horsepower at 8000 rpm.

name: Ducati 175
description: With production of the overhead camshaft singles well underway for 1958 the Formula 3 superseded the Marianna (the Gran Sport's nickname) as a catalogued production racer. The F3 was first offered as a 125 and 175, and from 1960, a 250, and was still largely Marianna based. Almost nothing, however, from the production street bikes was used in the F3.

name: Ducati 200
description: The Ducati 200 Elite (1959) is a classic Italian sportbike known for its sleek design and strong performance, solidifying Ducati's reputation in the late 1950s.

name: Ducati 250
description: A versatile motorcycle designed for both on-road and light off-road use, popular among enthusiasts for its agility and classic styling.

name: Ducati 350
description: A sport-oriented motorcycle featuring Ducati's desmodromic valve system, offering enhanced performance and a distinctive riding experience.

name: Ducati 400
description: Developed primarily for markets with specific licensing regulations, this model offered the aesthetic appeal of larger Ducati sportbikes in a more accessible package.

name: Ducati 450
description: The Ducati 450 was part of Ducati's single-cylinder series, popular for its performance, reliability, and distinctive style in the late '60s and early '70s.

name: Ducati 48
description: The Ducati 48 was a compact, economical motorcycle ideal for city commuting, widely popular in post-war Italy.

name: Ducati 50
description: The Ducati 50 was a lightweight, entry-level bike suitable for young riders, offering an affordable way into motorcycling.

name: Ducati 500
description: The Ducati 500, also known as the parallel twin, represented Ducati's experimentation with parallel twin engines, offering smooth riding and distinct styling.

name: Ducati 55
description: The Ducati 55 was an economical and practical motorcycle, popular in mid-1950s Italy for its reliability and ease of maintenance.

name: Ducati 60
description: Ducati 60 was one of Ducati's earliest lightweight motorcycles, introducing the brand to a wider audience post-World War II.

name: Ducati 600
description: The Ducati 600 Pantah represented a significant technical advancement for Ducati, laying foundations for the modern era of the brand.

name: Ducati 620
description: The Ducati 620 Monster combined sporty handling and everyday usability, making it a favorite among new and experienced riders alike.

name: Ducati 65
description: The Ducati 65 was known for its simplicity and efficiency, catering to budget-conscious riders of the post-war period.

name: Ducati 650
description: The Ducati 650 Indiana was Ducati's attempt at a cruiser-style bike, offering relaxed ergonomics and smooth cruising performance.

name: Ducati 748
description: The Ducati 748 was celebrated for its superb handling, compact size, and impressive power delivery, making it popular in the superbike segment.

name: Ducati 749
description: Ducati 749 offered advanced racing technology and aggressive styling, appealing to enthusiasts who valued performance and aesthetics.

name: Ducati 750
description: The Ducati 750 is iconic, featuring Ducati's first L-twin engine, revered for its groundbreaking performance and timeless design.

name: Ducati 80
description: Ducati 80 was compact yet powerful enough for daily commuting and leisure riding, appealing to a wide demographic in the 1960s.

name: Ducati 800
description: The Ducati 800 series provided a balance of power, handling, and style, suitable for both experienced riders and newcomers alike.

name: Ducati 848
description: The Ducati 848 offered exceptional power, handling, and technology, making it a highly regarded middleweight sportbike.

name: Ducati 85
description: The Ducati 85 was known for reliability, simple design, and ease of handling, appealing to practical-minded riders.

name: Ducati 851
description: The Ducati 851 was Ducati's first superbike featuring a four-valve engine, paving the way for modern superbike performance.

name: Ducati 860
description: Ducati 860 combined Italian styling with dependable performance, maintaining Ducati's tradition of sporty and capable road bikes.

name: Ducati 888
description: The Ducati 888 set new benchmarks in superbike racing, known for its outstanding power, precision handling, and race-proven pedigree.

name: Ducati 900
description: The Ducati 900 series was famous for its powerful L-twin engines and classic Italian styling, offering strong performance with iconic Ducati character.

name: Ducati 916
description: The Ducati 916 is an iconic superbike, renowned for its revolutionary design and exceptional performance on both street and track.

name: Ducati 98
description: The Ducati 98 was a versatile, practical motorcycle designed for everyday use, known for its ease of handling and reliability.

name: Ducati 996
description: The Ducati 996 evolved from the legendary 916, featuring improved performance, handling, and aesthetics, dominating the superbike scene.

name: Ducati 998
description: The Ducati 998 continued the lineage of iconic superbikes, combining racing heritage with advanced technology and performance.

name: Ducati 999
description: The Ducati 999 offered striking design and state-of-the-art technology, representing a new era of Ducati superbikes.

name: Ducati Apollo
description: The Ducati Apollo was a groundbreaking prototype designed for the American market, known for its powerful V4 engine and distinctive styling.

name: Ducati Brio
description: The Ducati Brio was an affordable scooter featuring Italian styling and practicality, appealing to urban commuters.

name: Ducati Brisk
description: The Ducati Brisk was a compact, efficient, and easy-to-handle motorcycle, suitable for city riding and short trips.

name: Ducati Cruiser
description: The Ducati Cruiser was Ducati's first attempt at creating a luxury scooter, characterized by its unique styling and advanced features for the era.

name: Ducati Cucciolo
description: The Ducati Cucciolo was Ducati's iconic motorized bicycle engine, which became immensely popular due to its affordability and reliability.

name: Ducati Desmo
description: The Ducati Desmo introduced Ducati's desmodromic valve system, significantly enhancing engine performance and reliability.

name: Ducati Desmosedici RR
description: The Ducati Desmosedici RR was a road-legal replica of Ducati's MotoGP race bike, renowned for its extreme performance and exclusivity.

name: Ducati Elite
description: The Ducati Elite combined elegant styling with reliable performance, making it a popular choice among enthusiasts in the late '50s and '60s.

name: Ducati GT
description: The Ducati GT series was well-known for combining comfortable touring capabilities with robust performance and reliability.

name: Ducati Hyperstrada
description: The Ducati Hyperstrada blended practicality with performance, designed for both spirited riding and touring.

name: Ducati Mach
description: The Ducati Mach was recognized for its sporty design and competitive performance in smaller displacement classes.

name: Ducati Mark
description: The Ducati Mark offered practicality, ease of maintenance, and reliable performance, popular among riders seeking daily usability.

name: Ducati Mille
description: The Ducati Mille was a high-performance motorcycle featuring an advanced engine and distinctive Ducati styling, favored by enthusiasts.

name: Ducati Pantah
description: The Ducati Pantah revolutionized Ducati's engineering approach, laying the groundwork for modern Ducati designs.

name: Ducati Paso
description: The Ducati Paso was known for its fully enclosed aerodynamic fairing, innovative technology, and refined performance.

name: Ducati Paul Smart
description: The Ducati Paul Smart commemorated the legendary racer, blending classic Ducati style with modern technology and performance.

name: Ducati Piuma
description: The Ducati Piuma was a lightweight racing motorcycle known for agility and competitive performance on the racing circuits of the 1950s.

name: Ducati Siluro
description: The Ducati Siluro was designed for racing enthusiasts, known for its aerodynamic form and competitive track performance.

name: Ducati Sport
description: The Ducati Sport provided riders with a sporty yet practical motorcycle, well-regarded for its powerful performance and agility.

name: Ducati ST
description: The Ducati ST series blended sportbike performance with touring comfort, catering to riders who valued long-distance comfort without sacrificing agility.

name: Ducati Supermono
description: The Ducati Supermono was a lightweight racing motorcycle recognized for its innovative design, outstanding handling, and superior track performance.

name: Ducati TT
description: The Ducati TT was designed specifically for competitive racing, featuring advanced technology and robust performance characteristics.
